DOC.brief_summary: RATIONALE : Palliative care may effective standard care improve quality life symptom patient lung cancer . PURPOSE : This clinical trial study effect palliative care quality life symptom control patient stage IIIB stage IV non-small cell lung cancer remove surgery .
DOC.brief_title: Effects Palliative Care Quality Life Symptom Control Patients With Stage IIIB Stage IV Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer That Can Be Removed Surgery
DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To compare effect palliative care intervention ( PCI ) v standard care overall quality life psychological distress patient unresectable stage IIIB IV non-small cell lung cancer . - To compare symptom control patient . - To compare geriatric assessment outcome , measure OARS Instrumental Activities Daily Living , MOS Activities Daily Living , MOS Social Activities Limitation Scale , Hospital Anxiety Depression Scale score , Karnofsky performance scale , patient . - To compare effect PCI v standard care resource use . - To identify subgroups patient benefit PCI relation sociodemographic characteristic , treatment factor , geriatric assessment predictor week 12 . OUTLINE : Patients assign 1 2 group . Group I ( usual care ) : Patients receive standard care . Group II ( palliative care intervention ) : Patients receive individualized interdisciplinary palliative care intervention comprise session , focus physical , psychological , social , spiritual well-being , weekly week 3-6 . Patients receive 4 follow-up phone call week 9 , 13 , 17 , 21 .
